snippet: In the highest-profile trial of a Greek politician since 1991, a former defense minister was convicted along with 16 others, including his wife and daughter.
abstract: Akis Tsochatzopoulos, former Greek defense minister, is found guilty of setting up a complex money-laundering network to cover the trail of millions of dollars in bribes that he is said to have pocketed from government weapons purchases; it is the highest-profile case against a Greek politician in more than two decades.
lead_paragraph: In the highest-profile trial of a Greek politician since 1991, a former defense minister was convicted along with 16 others, including his wife and daughter.

headline.main: Ex-Minister in Greece Is Found Guilty in Bribery Case
headline.print_headline: Ex-Minister In Greece Is Found Guilty In Bribery Case
